name: Music Centre
comment:
+Added Guitar Tuner

Music Centre is an application that makes the boring tasks a musician has to do, easier and quicker.

Music Centre helps musicians tune a range of instruments including Ukulele , Guitar , Mandolin and Bass, but it is possible to tune any instrument using the in built chromatic tuner.

The application also features a metronome to help musicians keep in time while practicing.

Also featured for each instrument is a full set of chord patterns for musicians practicing chords.

For the draft of this application included is the fully working Ukulele Centre showing how the individual instrument tuners and chord sections will work, these features will be included for all of the other "centers" , including Guitar, Mandolin and Bass in the finished version.

Also fully working in the draft is the Middle C Chromatic tuner to show the look and feel of how the chromatic tuners will work in the final version.

The main aim of the application is to provide musicians with a single application which can provide them with tuners and chord charts for a range of different instruments as well as a metronome. The application aims to make these tasks easy in an attractive software environment.

The only thing that I believe I will have to leave out of the application will be that each instrument chord section will only contain root chords for each instrument due to time constraints related to the time it takes to record and convert so many individual chords.

In terms of interface I have gone with a design that I believe  will be familiar to most users with navigation gained through the use of buttons to access other pages in the application, as well as a back button to go backwards through these pages. The user interacts with the application by tapping the buttons on the applications interface.

In terms of art style I have tried to make my application look like a musicians scrap book and I have strived to create a consistent look and feel throughout the application.

All of the art assets seen on the interface including buttons , background images and illustrations have been created by myself in adobe illustrator.

All of the sounds heard in the application have been created by myself either by recording myself playing ukulele or by sampling sounds from Fl Studio (for the chromatic tuner).

References:

Font which has been used has been obtained from: http://www.fontspace.com/phantomhive-company/the-octopus
Which can be used for non-commercial use.

The sounds sampled for the Chromatic Tuner were obtained from the software package FL Studio:
http://www.image-line.com/documents/flstudio.html


All other sounds and images used in the application have been created by myself.

decls.comment: State is used to store the applications current state for example if the user is in the ukulele menu the state would be set to "ukulele" , so when the back button is pressed appropriate action can be taken determined by the state global variable

Action to display the visual elements needed for the guitar menu
NOT YET DEVELOPED IN DRAFT
The guitar chords screen will work in the exact same way as the ukulele chords screen where each individual chord pattern will be placed onto the board
Then if the user touches a chord pattern the associated chord will be played
This action creates and displays all the visual elements of the bass centre
Event is triggered when the user presses the button to launch the bass menu
NOT YET DEVELOPED IN DRAFT VERSION
The bass tuner will work in the exact same way as the included ukulele tuner.
This bassTuner() action will place all of the tuner buttons on the screen change the applications global state variable as well as place an illustrated bass picture on the screen
When each tuner button is pressed the corresponding bass note will be sounded
NOT YET DEVELOPED IN DRAFT VERSION

This action will be used to put all of the required visual elements on the bass chords screen in the application. It will work in the exact same way as the existing ukulele chords screen but with bass chords.
NOT YET DEVELOPED IN DRAFT VERSION
The application will include a metronome where the user can select the desired time signature and bpm of the metronome.

Presented on the screen will be a start and stop button for the metronome. When the metronome starts the user will be presented with a large number on the screen representing the current beat that the metronome is up to.

I plan to implement this metronome functionality through the use of a loop (for loop) which will print the number of the current beat on the screen as well as make a clicking sound in sync with the presentation of the number. The loop will need to be slowed down to the desired bpm and I believe this will be possible through the use of a sleep function.
NOT YET DEVELOPED IN DRAFT VERSION
A recorder which a user can use to record sound will also be included in the application . Where the user can press a record button to record sound and a button to play it back.
Users will also be able to save recorded sounds
